Key Match Events: Kyle Harrison allowed five runs in the fifth inning, leading to the Brewers' 5-3 victory over the Giants.
William Contreras hit a two-run homer in the fifth inning.
Freddy Peralta threw six scoreless innings for the Brewers, allowing only two hits and striking out eight.
Matt Chapman hit a leadoff double in the seventh inning and later scored on Thairo Estrada’s infield single.
Michael Conforto hit a run-scoring double in the eighth inning.
Heliot Ramos hit an RBI single in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Harrison expressed frustration over his performance, stating he felt great but got out of rhythm and didn't make as good of pitches as he'd like.
Bob Melvin commented on Harrison's performance, noting he pitched well until the fifth inning when things quickly unraveled.
Thairo Estrada reflected on the team's effort to score early and make the job easier for the starting pitcher, acknowledging that sometimes things don't work out.
Thairo Estrada addressed a report about being placed on waivers, stating it's something he can't control and will continue to play hard to help the team win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Giants' loss put them 6 1/2 games out of the final NL Wild Card berth.
The Giants have not officially confirmed the report that Thairo Estrada and relievers Taylor Rogers and Tyler Matzek had been placed on waivers.
